DataElement.preferredName: Lung Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary lung cancer based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to clinical T stage of a lung tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.longName: Lung
Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Clinical
Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/17/17 tt associated with CS/CSI. 9/13/17 tt transferred context; changed def - 1st letter upper case; changed Reg Status to Qualified. 11/20/11 Retired BCRv1.0 content as part of model cleanup task. 12/16/2011 - unretired CTEP.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Lung Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system derives from analyses of the new retrospective and prospective databases of the International Association for the Study of Lung Cancer (IASLC). These databases contain information on patients diagnosed with lung cancer from 1999 to 2010 originating from 35 different databases in 16 countries around the world. This classification system applies to carcinomas of the lung, including non-small cell and small cell carcinomas, and bronchopulmonary carcinoid tumors. It does not apply to sarcomas or other rare tumors of the lung. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 7 cm or tumor of any size invading one or more of the following: diaphragm, mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, recurrent laryngeal nerve, esophagus, vertebral body, or carina; separate tumor nodule(s) in an ipsilateral lobe different from that of the primary. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 7 cm or tumor of any size invading one or more of the following: diaphragm, mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, recurrent laryngeal nerve, esophagus, vertebral body, or carina; separate tumor nodule(s) in an ipsilateral lobe different from that of the primary. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 5 cm but 7 cm or less in greatest dimension or directly invading any of the following: parietal pleura (PL3), chest wall (including superior sulcus tumors), phrenic nerve, parietal pericardium; or separate tumor nodule(s) in the same lobe as the primary. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 5 cm but 7 cm or less in greatest dimension or directly invading any of the following: parietal pleura (PL3), chest wall (including superior sulcus tumors), phrenic nerve, parietal pericardium; or separate tumor nodule(s) in the same lobe as the primary. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 4 cm but 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 4 cm but 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 3 cm but 4 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 3 cm but 4 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 3 cm but 5 cm or less in greatest dimension or having any of the following features: involves the main bronchus regardless of distance to the carina, but without involvement of the carina, invades visceral pleura (extends through the elastic layer-PL1 or extends to the surface of the visceral pleura-PL2), or is associated with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis that extends to the hilar region, involving part or all of the lung. T2 tumors with these features are classified as T2a if they measure 4 cm or less or if the size cannot be determined and T2b if they measure more than 4 cm but 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 3 cm but 5 cm or less in greatest dimension or having any of the following features: involves the main bronchus regardless of distance to the carina, but without involvement of the carina, invades visceral pleura (extends through the elastic layer-PL1 or extends to the surface of the visceral pleura-PL2), or is associated with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis that extends to the hilar region, involving part or all of the lung. T2 tumors with these features are classified as T2a if they measure 4 cm or less or if the size cannot be determined and T2b if they measure more than 4 cm but 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 1 cm but 2 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 1 cm but 2 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with tumor 1 cm or less in greatest dimension. A superficial, spreading tumor of any size whose invasive component is limited to the bronchial wall and may extend proximal to the main bronchus also is classified as T1a, but these tumors are uncommon. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with tumor 1 cm or less in greatest dimension. A superficial, spreading tumor of any size whose invasive component is limited to the bronchial wall and may extend proximal to the main bronchus also is classified as T1a, but these tumors are uncommon. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with tumor 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura, without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with tumor 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura, without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer without evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer without evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. Squamous cell carcinoma in situ (SCIS). Adenocarcinoma in situ (AIS): adenocarcinoma with pure lepidic pattern, 3 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. Squamous cell carcinoma in situ (SCIS). Adenocarcinoma in situ (AIS): adenocarcinoma with pure lepidic pattern, 3 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pT1mi TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pT1mi TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with minimally invasive adenocarcinoma: adenocarcinoma (3 cm or less in greatest dimension) with a predominantly lepidic pattern and 5 mm or less invasion in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT1mi TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with minimally invasive adenocarcinoma: adenocarcinoma (3 cm or less in greatest dimension) with a predominantly lepidic pattern and 5 mm or less invasion in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pT1c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pT1c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 2 cm but 3 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT1c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with tumor measuring more than 2 cm but 3 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system derives from analyses of the new retrospective and prospective databases of the International Association for the Study of Lung Cancer (IASLC). These databases contain information on patients diagnosed with lung cancer from 1999 to 2010 originating from 35 different databases in 16 countries around the world. This classification system applies to carcinomas of the lung, including non-small cell and small cell carcinomas, and bronchopulmonary carcinoid tumors. It does not apply to sarcomas or other rare tumors of the lung. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system derives from analyses of the new retrospective and prospective databases of the International Association for the Study of Lung Cancer (IASLC). These databases contain information on patients diagnosed with lung cancer from 1999 to 2010 originating from 35 different databases in 16 countries around the world. This classification system applies to carcinomas of the lung, including non-small cell and small cell carcinomas, and bronchopulmonary carcinoid tumors. It does not apply to sarcomas or other rare tumors of the lung. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: American Joint Committee on Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ReferenceDocuments.name: MCL-PCA-Lung-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Extent of the primary cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.
